newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian tin prices rise on industrial demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian tin prices rise on industrial demand.

text.p: Tin prices bounced back on Tuesday helped by industrial demand and stronger overseas prices, traders said.
Prices rose 300 rupees to 31,500 per quintal after falling by same amount last week.
Copper and zinc extended gains on shortage of ready stock and poor arrivals of imported metals. Copper and zinc rose 50 rupees each, to 13,450 and 7,700 per quintal respectively.
Lead was quiet at 4,550 rupees per quintal and aluminium at 7,400 in light trading.
